titleStmt.title: Reflection, in vindication of one arch-deacon (and consequently of all) from the scurrilous and groundless invectives against him, (besides several other more eminent persons) in a late scandalous pamplet [sic], intituled, A pretended visitor visited. In a letter, &c.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for Awnsham Churchil, at the Black Swan in Ave-mary-Lane,

notesStmt.note: Caption title on p. 1 reads: A vindication of one arch-deacon, &c.
The "one arch-deacon" refers to Francis Fullwood, arch-deacon of Totnes (cf. Wing).
The "late scandalous pamplet" [sic] refers to: "[Hebrew] or, A (pretended) visitor visited", published in 1690 (cf. Wing P3318A).
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library, Oxford.
